text: Mary Pat Gleason (February 23, 1950 – June 2, 2020) was an American actress and television writer. From 1983 to 1985, she appeared on The Guiding Light as Jane Hogan. She won an Emmy Award for television writing 1986. She appeared in a 1994 episode of Friends as Nurse Sizemore. Gleason was born in Lake City, Minnesota. Gleason died on June 2, 2020 in Los Angeles, California from uterine cancer, aged 70.Mary Pat Gleason Dies: ‘Mom’, ‘A Cinderella Story’ Actor Was 70 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:Writers from Minnesota Category:Actors from Minnesota Category:American television writers Category:American stage actors Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Deaths from uterine cancer Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Mary Pat Gleason
